REASONING: Sharing intelligence (B) is paramount for situational awareness and strengthens Taiwan's defensive posture. Military posturing and exercises (H) can demonstrate resolve and deterrence. High-level diplomatic visits (A) reaffirm support for Taiwan. Public criticism (G) can help sway international public opinion against China’s actions. Defense and security agreements (C) provide a structured framework for long-term cooperation. Engaging in international arbitration (E) and peace negotiations (F) introduce diplomatic means to de-escalate tensions. Increasing cyber capacities (J) and military capacities (K) can ensure U.S.A is better prepared. Negotiating trade agreements (D) supports Taiwan economically. Surveillance drones (I) provide critical real-time intelligence. Trade restrictions (M) and cutting diplomatic ties (L) are pricy and may escalate tensions but are less immediate. Supplying more weapons (N) might aggravate China. Cybersecurity attacks (O) carry risks of severe retaliation. Targeted military attacks (P), full invasions (Q), and any form of nuclear strikes (R, S) are highly escalatory and could lead to catastrophic war.
